main.docTitle: Maximum Scale of Election Expenses (District Boards) Order 1994

editorialNote.content: This Order was originally made under the Corrupt and Illegal Practices Ordinance (Cap. 288). Though that Ordinance was repealed, this Order continues in force so far as it is not inconsistent with the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554) and has the effect for all purposes as if made under Cap. 554. (See section 48 of Cap. 554)

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: by-election (補選) and ordinary election (一般選舉) have the meanings assigned to them in the Electoral Provisions Ordinance (Cap. 367);
relevant date (有關日期) means the date of the coming into operation of the Specification;
the Specification (指明) means the District Boards (Date of Establishment) Specification 1994 (Cap. 366 sub. leg. J).

section.name: s2
section.heading: Maximum scale of election expenses
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 13(1) of the Ordinance*, the maximum scale of election expenses which may be incurred by or on behalf of a candidate in respect of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the ordinary election of persons to act as elected members of the District Boards established under the Specification; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any by-election to fill a vacancy in the office of an elected member of any District Board so established,

tr.td: “Ordinance” refers to the repealed Corrupt and Illegal Practices Ordinance (Cap. 288).

section.name: s3
section.heading: Saving and transitional
section.content: Nothing in this Order shall affect the maximum scale of election expenses in existence immediately before the relevant date in respect of any by-election, held before the date of the ordinary election referred to in section 2(a), to fill a vacancy in the office of an elected member of any District Board established under the Ordinance before the relevant date.
